# performClickOnCell(atColumn:row:)

**Instance Method**

Performs a click action on the cell at the specified row and column.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func performClickOnCell(atColumn column: Int, row: Int)
```

## Parameters

- **column**: The column of the cell.
- **row**: The row of the cell.

## Discussion

Acquires the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView], copies it, invokes [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/performClick(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopUpButtonCell/performClick(withFrame:in:)] (if the cell is an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopUpButtonCell]), and then updates the data source, if required. This method does not do any checks to see if the cell is enabled.



## Deprecated Methods

- **focusedColumn()**: Returns the currently focused column.
- **setFocusedColumn(_:)**: Sets the currently focused column to the specified index.
- **shouldFocusCell(_:atColumn:row:)**: Returns whether the fully prepared cell at the specified row and column can be made the focused cell.
- **preparedCell(atColumn:row:)**: Returns the fully prepared cell that the table view will use for drawing or processing of the specified row and column.
